Author: DLochner
Review: A Nepalese shows it to the world. Anyone who goes mountaineering themselves can certainly assess the enormous performance of the man a bit better than a layman. Nevertheless, it should be said that great things have been achieved here. And the film shows that too. Perhaps he cannot match the emotional strength of Jimmy Chin with his film Free Solo, but it has an important message in it: Sherpas are the real heroes of the mountains, without them many of the western mountaineers would not be able to climb all the 8,000-meter peaks. Nirmal Purja, a little hero.

Author: anthonydapiii
Review_Title: Incredible Doc - One of the Best Ever
Review: "From the beginning of our life, we are approaching death."

Author: paul-allaer
Review_Title: Riveting and inspiring documentary--almost too much to take in
Review: "14 Peaks: Nothing Is Impossible" (2021 release; 101 min.) is a documentary about a Nepal mountaineer's seemingly impossible attempt to summit the earth's 14 mountains that are higher than 8000 meters, all in a single season (April through October, 2019). "Don't be afraid to dream big", reflects Nirmal Purja, the man at issue. We then go back in time as we learn of Purja's modest upbringing and his eventual joining of the UK Special Forces. Along the way we are also introduced to Purja's family, non more so than his now-ailing mother, who looms over the family's history. At this point we are 10 min into the documentary.

Author: radhrh
Review_Title: Stick your superhero movies up your......
Review: Nimsdai (Nims ) Purja was born poor in Nepal. He joined the British army Ghurka regiment where he served for six years before joining the elite SBS where he served a further ten years. That would be plenty for most, but not Nims. After his first mountaineering experience in 2014 he decided to climb 14 of the World's highest and most dangerous peaks. This feat had been achieved before but took eight years to complete. Nims Purja attempted it in 7 months! A single climbing season.

Author: backnblack-06123
Review_Title: you dont have to be a climber to love this
Review:
This was amazing and one of the best I've seen, his a intelligent man with amazing DNA that none of us have his wife is a complete angel for allowing him this freedom to live his dreams
If you like this and you will the doc on Fred Becky is slightly better its available on amazon for a price i think a one day rental was $1.

Author: brockfal
Review: I love films about people taking on great challenges, but this is something else! Gurka Nimsdai Purja and his team of four scale the 14 highest mountains over 8000m, and in just 7 months. Spectacular in every way, it's quite a ride, and though there isn't much time to dwell on the details of climbing the individual mountains so it all feels a bit rushed at times (14 mountains in 110 mins) the film still gives overviews which are illustrated well. You wonder what they'll top this achievement with!!

Author: khadkas-91629
Review: Utterly awe-inspiring and a reminder of how so many people are ignored and taken for granted.

Author: Thanos_Alfie
Review: "14 Peaks: Nothing Is Impossible" is a Documentary in which we watch Nirmal Purja, a Nepali mountaineer trying the impossible task of summit all the 14, 8,000-meter peaks in just seven months.

Author: shirlone
Review: I loved this movie. It took so much determination, courage and focus on climbing all the higher mountains. This is absolutely a must watch movie/ documentary. The view from the summits is totally incredible.

Author: rahuldasbabon
Review: Mind blowing, hats off to the team. Thanks Netflix for showcasing such amazing talent. He really showed what a human being is capable of. Such an inspiration for many climbers.

Author: kmonisha-16845
Review: Loved watching the journey of Nims. He is extraordinary. He truly represented the Nepali climbers and proved himself as a strategic fearless leader. Loved his confidence and how he says more wonders are yet to come. Love for his whole team and his wife. What a wonderful lady his wife seemed like. Absolutely amazed by her mental strength. Well made documentary with beautiful visuals of the ferocious mountains.

Author: gcarpiceci
Review_Title: I review the documentary, not the project
Review: Let's get this clear upfront: I am reviewing the documentary here, not the endeavour nor its protagonist - they both have my deepest respect and admiration.

Review: The achievement itself is great, but we are here to talk about the documentary.

Review: The inspiration aspect is great and it was an incredible feat. But I was memorized by the shear beauty of these mountains.

Review: This documentary is completely wholesome - I can't get enough of these mountain climbing docus.

Author: maytekinaliyeva
Review: The guy climbed fourteen highest mountains. All I have to do is to give him 10 stars. What can I say? I was amazed by his motivation and mental strength.

Author: shashwatblack
Review: This was an amazing watch. Loved the thrill, the incredible shots, the inspiring story, all of it.

Author: rupak369
Review_Title: One of the best ever. Legend
Review: Nims Purja is a legend. This documentary deserves all the praise, respect and liking. From the cinematography to the shots, everything was flawless. The journey showcased is out of this world. Wish him more power. Project Possible.

Author: austin-19993
Review: Was waiting for this since a year, was searching all over youtube for his documentary. When it was finally here, they could have captures the moments and the journey properly. Less then 2 hrs for such once in a life time achievement, its like they show him at the base camp, then in the middle somewhere and then the summit with the date. What about the challenges, difficulties, the whole story about each mountain, and the joy of reaching the summit, how he gathered funds initially. The 3rd phase especially got over even before it started. Such nice photography and pictures but somewhere theres a feeling of incompleteness. You could watch some of the non-netflix youtube videos and how they have captured all the important things.

Author: new859
Review: Don't have any expectation when I start watching it. The achievement this guy had is huge. As he said in the movie, if a westerner did what he did, the public recognition would be10 times bigger. I watched many documentaries on mountaineering. All of the movies are telling one peak climbing. And it is already owe inspiring. Now this guy did 14 peaks. I can't help thinking the other climbers are kindergartner comparing to him. He makes climbing mount Everest seems so easy. What he have done is not 10times harder than climbing mount Everest. It's 100 times harder because he has to do 14 peaks within 7 month. I doubt anyone else in the world can do it. As a movie, this movie has a lot to improve. It fails to show the difficulty of climbing these peaks. It's also fails to show why this guy is so strong. Michael Phelps has unique body features. This guy has huge belly. It's against common sense. Scientists need to do some research on him.

Author: kinkyswarley
Review: Wow, what an inspiration and drive for any human on earth, mesmerising journey in every sense of the word, Nim is truly a legend, also completely nuts, but a legend as well. Great directing and producing also.

Author: dannylee-78082
Review_Title: Pushing the boundaries of human capacity
Review: For anyone who's ever hiked a decent mountain may have a small grasp of what an incredible feat Nims has achieved. It truly is unbelievable. Beautifully made documentary as well. The views at the summit were quite stunning and a handful of people can get footage of those even for just one summit. I really loved that Nims was doing this not because for his own ego but for the representation of his own country. Nothing but the most utmost respect to the man and also whoever made the documentary so that more people are aware of him.

Author: ayush-kadel
Review_Title: Giving up is not in blood
Review: The new Netflix documentary "14 peaks : Nothing is impossible" is highly inspirational story of the Nepali mountaineer Nirmal Purja. It documents his biggest dream to summit all 14 of the world 8000 meter + peaks in just seven months. We also get glimpse of his early days, his physical and mental preparation for this seemingly impossible quest.

Author: phillpdodds
Review: I've followed Nims' journey on social media for a while so I was expecting something pretty special from this documentary. I'm massively understating it by saying I wasn't disappointed. Nims and his team are nothing short of superhuman. The documentary itself is beautifully presented. Inspiring and emotive. The feat is incredible and downright ridiculous to even consider possible (I mean, who thinks about climbing 3 x 8000m+ peaks in 48 hours?!?!) But the special bond Nims has with his native Nepal and the awareness he brings to viewers as to the special nature of its climbing community is just beautiful. Add to that the film's presentation of the obvious love, pride and respect of his family and it all makes for a very special documentary that pushes the boundaries of what the human body and mind are capable of. He says he'll be back with something bigger next time...how is that even possible?? Well for Nims I guess "nothing is impossible."

Author: leskenn-201-108058
Review_Title: What a force of nature Nims is !
Review: This guy us unstoppable.
